noun.description: A diplomatic minister, especially one below the rank of ambassador, and their staff.
examples: they placed a bomb on the train carrying the British Legation to Istanbul

noun.description: The position or office of legate; a legateship.

origin: Late Middle English (denoting the sending of a papal legate; also the mission itself): from Latin legatio(n-), from legare depute, delegate, bequeath.
